columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique identifier for each query execution.

columns.name: workgroup
columns.description: The name of the workgroup in which the query ran.

columns.name: catalog
columns.description: The name of the data catalog used in the query execution.

columns.name: database
columns.description: The name of the data database used in the query execution.

columns.name: query
columns.description: The SQL query statements which the query execution ran.

columns.name: effective_engine_version
columns.description: The engine version on which the query runs.

columns.name: selected_engine_version
columns.description: The engine version requested by the users.

columns.name: execution_parameters
columns.description: A list of values for the parameters in a query.

columns.name: statement_type
columns.description: The type of query statement that was run.

columns.name: substatement_type
columns.description: The kind of query statement that was run.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The state of query execution.

columns.name: state_change_reason
columns.description: Further detail about the status of the query.

columns.name: submission_date_time
columns.description: The date and time that the query was submitted.

columns.name: completion_date_time
columns.description: The date and time that the query completed.

columns.name: error_message
columns.description: Contains a short description of the error that occurred.

columns.name: error_type
columns.description: An integer value that provides specific information about an Athena query error.

columns.name: error_category
columns.description: An integer value that specifies the category of a query failure error.

columns.name: retryable
columns.description: True if the query might succeed if resubmitted.

columns.name: data_manifest_location
columns.description: The location and file name of a data manifest file.

columns.name: data_scanned_in_bytes
columns.description: The number of bytes in the data that was queried.

columns.name: engine_execution_time_in_millis
columns.description: The number of milliseconds that the query took to execute.

columns.name: query_planning_time_in_millis
columns.description: The number of milliseconds that Athena took to plan the query processing flow.

columns.name: query_queue_time_in_millis
columns.description: The number of milliseconds that the query was in your query queue waiting for resources.

columns.name: service_processing_time_in_millis
columns.description: The number of milliseconds that Athena took to finalize and publish the query results after the query engine finished running the query.

columns.name: total_execution_time_in_millis
columns.description: The number of milliseconds that Athena took to run the query.

columns.name: reused_previous_result
columns.description: True if a previous query result was reused; false if the result was generated.

columns.name: s3_acl_option
columns.description: The Amazon S3 canned ACL that Athena should specify when storing query results.

columns.name: encryption_option
columns.description: Indicates whether Amazon S3 server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed keys (SSE_S3), server-side encryption with KMS-managed keys (SSE_KMS), or client-side encryption with KMS-managed keys (CSE_KMS) is used.

columns.name: kms_key
columns.description: For SSE_KMS and CSE_KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

columns.name: expected_bucket_owner
columns.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that you expect to be the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket specified by ResultConfiguration$OutputLocation.

columns.name: output_location
columns.description: The location in Amazon S3 where your query results are stored.

columns.name: result_reuse_by_age_enabled
columns.description: True if previous query results can be reused when the query is run.

columns.name: result_reuse_by_age_mag_age_in_minutes
columns.description: Specifies, in minutes, the maximum age of a previous query result that Athena should consider for reuse. The default is 60.
